pkgmetadata.longdescription: # http-basic-auth[![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/bugov/http-basic-auth.svg?branch=master)](https://travis-ci.org/bugov/http-basic-auth)Yep, it's one more HTTP Basic Auth python lib. The second. And I triedto use the first, but it had a bug (which I fixed) and... completelywrong realisation of non-latin encoding/decoding.# Install```bashpip3 install http-basic-auth```# ‚ô•Ô∏è RFCIt supports only RFC-2617 (RFC-7617 planning).If you find some mistake ‚Äì please write to [issue list üê®](https://github.com/bugov/http-basic-auth/issues).# ‚ô•Ô∏è Non-latin symbolshttp-basic-auth ‚ô• utf-8```bash‚Üí curl --user name:–ø–∞—Ä–æ–ª—å https://httpbin.org/headers{ "headers": { "Accept": "*/*", "Authorization": "Basic bmFtZTrQv9Cw0YDQvtC70Yw=", "Connection": "close", "Host": "httpbin.org", "User-Agent": "curl/7.54.0" }}```And even```bash‚Üí curl --user üòÅ:–ø–∞—Ä:√∂–ª—å https://httpbin.org/headers{ "headers": { "Accept": "*/*", "Authorization": "Basic 8J+YgTrQv9Cw0YA6w7bQu9GM", "Connection": "close", "Host": "httpbin.org", "User-Agent": "curl/7.54.0" }}```All works well```pythonfrom http_basic_auth import generate_header, parse_headerassert "Basic 8J+YgTrQv9Cw0YA6w7bQu9GM" == generate_header('üòÅ', '–ø–∞—Ä:√∂–ª—å')assert ('üòÅ', '–ø–∞—Ä:√∂–ª—å') == parse_header("Basic 8J+YgTrQv9Cw0YA6w7bQu9GM")```# Provides functions- `generate_header`: `(user, password) ‚Üí "Basic <token>"`- `parse_header`: `"Basic <token>" ‚Üí (user, password)`- `generate_token`: `(user, password) ‚Üí "<token>"`- `parse_token`: `"<token>" ‚Üí (user, password)`
